title: Israel-Hamas war: US Secretary of State Blinken warns that conflict could spread throughout Middle East
description: The top US diplomat spoke in Qatar on the latest leg of his fourth Middle East tour since the start of the war aimed at de-escalating the conflict.

title: US Congress announces spending agreement that could avert government shutdown
description: Congressional leaders reached a crucial spending agreement to avert a government shutdown but face a tight deadline to enact the deal into legislation before January 19.

title: Cambodia: Traditional villages in Angkor under threat
description: The Cambodian authorities have launched a major project to relocate the residents of the archaeological site of the renowned Angkor temples, where the number of illegal constructions has surged.

title: Golden Globes 2024 tries to win back viewers' favor with new award for box-office hits
description: For the first time, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association will be giving an award for 'Cinematic and Box Office Achievement'.

title: Taiwan's young voters prepare for pivotal election, ambivalent about China and their future
description: These young Taiwanese in their twenties are preparing to vote in their first election on January 13. While they are aware of the threat China poses to their island and its democracy, they are nevertheless seduced by their powerful neighbor's culture and promises of prosperity.

title: Bangladesh's Hasina wins re-election after polls boycotted by opposition
description: Hasina's ruling Awami League 'has won more than 50 percent seats,' an Election Commission spokesman said on Sunday, with counting ongoing.

title: Companies imitate luxury hotel room service to entice employees back to the office
description: Covid-19 has permanently kept employees away from their open-plan offices. To reverse the trend, some employers are drawing on the luxury hotel industry's practices.

title: Iran woman gets 74 lashes for 'violating public morals'
description: Roya Heshmati was also ordered to pay a fine of 12 million rials (around $25) for "not wearing the Muslim veil in public," her lawyer said.

title: EU Council President Charles Michel to step down early
description: The Belgian has announced that he will step down early as European Council president after running in the European Parliament elections in June, raising questions about who will take over.

title: War in Gaza: The shadow of Alexander the Great's siege
description: To find a tragedy on the scale of the one happening today in Gaza, we'd have to go back to Alexander the Great's merciless siege of the city in 332 BC, writes Le Monde columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu.

title: The 'disobedient' children of Argentina's torturers
description: The daughters and sons of men accused of actively participating in repression during the dictatorship (1976-1983) are slowly discovering a past that has long remained secret. Some don't hesitate to disown their fathers.

title: From Paris to Marseille, French museums report record attendance in 2023
description: Most of France's cultural institutions, in Paris and in the rest of the country, have regained their pre-pandemic visitors.

title: Nadal out of Australian Open with muscle tear
description: The tennis champion had made his comeback from a year-long injury absence just a week ago.

title: Bangladesh votes in election boycotted by opposition
description: The country votes Sunday in an election guaranteed to give a fifth term in office to Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: French foreign minister urges Iran to stop 'destabilizing acts'
description: Catherine Colonna's call with her counterpart Amir Abdollahian came after the Iran-backed Hezbollah group in Lebanon said it had targeted an Israeli base with 62 missiles in response to the killing of a Hamas leader in Beirut.

title: The disappearance of local newspapers in the US weighs on democracy
description: In 2023, more than 130 publications had closed or been merged. One in five Americans now lives in an area lacking in news coverage. As the November 2024 presidential election approaches, initiatives are springing up to reverse the trend.

title: Belarus: The opposition tries to get out of Lukashenko's trap
description: The Belarusian leader is blocking exiled critics from renewing their documents abroad to force their return. Meanwhile, Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya's alternative government is pushing for EU recognition of their new passports.

title: US regulator orders grounding of Boeing MAX 9 planes after Alaska Airlines incident
description: Federal officials on Saturday ordered the immediate grounding and inspection of some Boeing 737 Max 9 planes following an emergency landing by an Alaska Airlines plane due to a window panel blowout post-takeoff.

title: AI start-ups are booming in San Francisco's 'Cerebral Valley'
description: A new generation of 'techies' has settled in Hayes Valley, the epicenter of a booming tech world. Here, AI creators are convinced that they are taking part in a 'civilizational change' that in the long term will benefit humanity.

title: 'Qatargate': Belgian investigation risks stalling
description: Over a year since the police raid in Brussels that exposed a corruption scandal in the European Parliament, there is uncertainty over whether the case will ever come to court.
